definition: to open to traffic (e.g. new bridge, rail line etc)/(of a locality) to have a transportation service/(Tw) to commute
to go through/to know well/(suffix) expert/to connect/to communicate/open/to clear/classifier for letters, telegrams, phone calls etc
classifier for an activity, taken in its entirety (tirade of abuse, stint of music playing, bout of drinking etc)
car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159
"through train" (refers to the idea of retaining previous legislature after transition to Chinese rule in Hong Kong or Macao)

sentences.english: China started operating its first subway in Beijing in 1969.
sentences.chinese: 中国的第一条地铁于1969年在北京建成通车。

sentences.english: Many city vehicles have been adapted for use as school buses.
sentences.chinese: 许多市内交通车都被改造为校用专车。

sentences.english: Sometimes you don't want an amphibious vehicle to look too much like a car.
sentences.chinese: 有时候你不想要一辆太像普通车的两栖车。

sentences.english: Next year in June, the waterfront section of road will achieve demi traffic.
sentences.chinese: 明年6月份，海滨大道将实现部分路段半幅通车。

sentences.english: I'd like to rent three standard bikes.
This railway will be electrified when there is a need.
sentences.chinese: 这条铁路将于十月一日通车。

sentences.english: With the growth of railroad traffic mileage rapidly, the moderate and small stations increase.
sentences.chinese: 铁路通车里程迅速增加，铁路中小站段随之增长。

sentences.english: When did the subway in Bejing begin operating?
sentences.chinese: 北京的地铁是什么时候开始通车的？

sentences.english: There's an airport bus that goes into the city every hour.
sentences.chinese: 每小时都有一班机场交通车去市区，逢正点开出。

sentences.english: With the growth of railroad traffic mileage, the moderate and small stations increase.
sentences.chinese: 随着铁路通车里程的增长，铁路中小站段随之增加。

sentences.english: I got up too late to catch the early bus.
sentences.chinese: 我睡觉太晚了，没赶上早交通车。

sentences.english: This railway will be opened to traffic in May at the latest.
sentences.chinese: 这条铁路至迟五月通车。

sentences.english: The current line has returned to normal traffic.
sentences.chinese: 目前全线已恢复正常通车。

sentences.english: With conventional cars, this is pretty much true.
sentences.chinese: 对普通车而言这是很现实的。

definition: to finish work/to complete a project
Da Qiao, one of the Two Qiaos, according to Romance of the Three Kingdoms 三國演義|三国演义[San1 guo2 Yan3 yi4], the two great beauties of ancient China
multiple track (e.g. rail)/multi-lane (e.g. highway)/the complex line (math.)
to join the two sections (of a linear structure: bridge, dike etc) to complete its construction
to begin work (of a factory or engineering operation)/to start a construction job
debugging and commissioning/testing (of a whole system)
